description: Unique identifier for this employee rate record.
Audit timestamp when this rate row was created or last updated (format yyyymmddHHMMSSmmm); used for change tracking.
Foreign key to the employee rate type (e.g., regular, overtime) that classifies the rate; joins via 'typer' to the referenced list.
Name of the reference list backing the 'type' field; used by generic foreign-key logic.
Identifier of the employee this rate applies to; foreign key to the employee master.
Name of the master data source for the employee foreign key.
Monetary amount for this employee’s rate, likely hourly; used for labor costing or billing. Confirm unit and currency with SME.
Marks the rate record as inactive so it’s ignored in lookups and calculations.
Flags this as the employee’s default rate when multiple rates exist.
Original identifier from the prior system to support back-reference and reconciliation.
Original table name from the prior system for lineage and audit.
